title: Art Centers & Museums
intro: Immerse yourself in Taiwan's rich history, diverse culture, and modern art at these world-class museums.

spots.name: National Museum of Marine Science and Technology (國立海洋科技博物館)
spots.description: Taiwan's most important marine science museum, dedicated to marine science, technology, and ecology.

spots.name: Keelung Museum of Art (基隆美術館)
spots.description: Formerly the Keelung Cultural Center, this is the city's primary venue for art and cultural exhibitions.

spots.name: YM Oceanic Culture and Art Museum (陽明海洋文化藝術館)
spots.description: Located near the harbor, it introduces oceanic culture and the history of shipping.

spots.name: National Palace Museum (國立故宮博物院)
spots.description: Houses a world-class collection of Chinese artifacts. The Jadeite Cabbage and Meat-shaped Stone are famous treasures.

spots.name: Taipei Fine Arts Museum (臺北市立美術館)
spots.description: Taiwan's first modern art museum and an iconic venue for contemporary art.

spots.name: National Museum of History (國立歷史博物館)
spots.description: Focuses primarily on historical artifacts from Taiwan and China.

spots.name: Museum of Contemporary Art Taipei (台北當代藝術館)
spots.description: Located in a historic building, MOCA Taipei focuses exclusively on contemporary and avant-garde art.

spots.name: National Taiwan Museum (國立臺灣博物館)
spots.description: Taiwan's oldest museum, showcasing history and natural science.

spots.name: Huashan 1914 Creative Park (華山1914文化創意產業園區)
spots.description: A major center for large-scale special exhibitions and cultural events hosted in repurposed industrial warehouses.

spots.name: MoNTUE (北師美術館)
spots.description: A museum with an academic and experimental nature, known for high-quality curation.

spots.name: Yingge Ceramics Museum (新北市立鶯歌陶瓷博物館)
spots.description: Located in the heart of Taiwan's pottery town, dedicated to ceramic art and history.

spots.name: Shihsanhang Museum of Archaeology (新北市立十三行博物館)
spots.description: An archaeological museum dedicated to the prehistoric Iron Age culture of Taiwan.

spots.name: Gold Museum (新北市立黃金博物館)
spots.description: Located in Jinguashi, preserving the history of the gold mining industry in the area.

spots.name: Juming Museum (朱銘美術館)
spots.description: Taiwan's largest outdoor sculpture museum, located in Jinshan, featuring works by Ju Ming.

spots.name: Museum of World Religions (世界宗教博物館)
spots.description: Located in Yonghe, this museum introduces major world religions and promotes tolerance.

spots.name: Taoyuan Children's Art Museum (桃園市兒童美術館)
spots.description: An art experience space designed specifically for children.

spots.name: Hengshan Calligraphy Art Center (橫山書法藝術館)
spots.description: Taiwan's first official museum dedicated to the art of calligraphy.

spots.name: Daxi Wood Art Ecomuseum (大溪木藝生態博物館)
spots.description: A 'museum without walls' preserving the woodcraft culture and historic buildings of Daxi.

spots.name: Hsinchu City Art Gallery (新竹市美術館)
spots.description: A Japanese-era brick building serving as a venue for contemporary art exhibitions.

spots.name: Glass Museum of Hsinchu City (新竹市玻璃工藝博物館)
spots.description: Showcases the famous glass craftsmanship and industry of Hsinchu.

spots.name: Xiao Ru Song Art Park (蕭如松藝術園區)
spots.description: Memorial park for the Hakka watercolor painter Xiao Ru Song, featuring preserved Japanese dormitories.

spots.name: Lanyang Museum (蘭陽博物館)
spots.description: Famous for its architecture resembling a cuesta rock formation, it exhibits Yilan's geography and culture.

spots.name: National Center for Traditional Arts (國立傳統藝術中心)
spots.description: A large park dedicated to preserving and performing Taiwan's traditional crafts and theater.

spots.name: Sanyi Wood Sculpture Museum (三義木雕博物館)
spots.description: Taiwan's only public museum dedicated to the art of wood sculpture.

spots.name: Taiwan Hakka Culture Development Center (臺灣客家文化館)
spots.description: Located in Tongluo, this museum showcases Hakka culture and history.

spots.name: National Taiwan Museum of Fine Arts (國立臺灣美術館)
spots.description: The only national-level fine arts museum in Taiwan, featuring a vast campus and sculpture park.

spots.name: National Museum of Natural Science (國立自然科學博物館)
spots.description: One of the most visited museums in Taiwan, covering natural history, science, and anthropology.

spots.name: National Taichung Theater (臺中國家歌劇院)
spots.description: Designed by Toyo Ito, this performance venue is an architectural masterpiece with internal exhibition spaces.

spots.name: Asia University Museum of Modern Art (亞洲大學現代美術館)
spots.description: Designed by Tadao Ando, housing a collection of modern sculptures and paintings.

spots.name: Changhua County Art Museum (彰化縣立美術館)
spots.description: A key venue for modern art exhibitions in Central Taiwan.

spots.name: Yu-Hsiu Museum of Art (毓繡美術館)
spots.description: A private museum in the mountains of Caotun, famous for contemporary realism art (Reservation required).

spots.name: Yunlin Hand Puppet Museum (雲林布袋戲館)
spots.description: Located in Huwei, exhibiting the history and culture of Taiwanese puppetry.

spots.name: Chiayi Art Museum (嘉義市立美術館)
spots.description: Converted from the old Tobacco and Liquor Bureau, a landmark blending old and new architecture.

spots.name: Southern Branch of the National Palace Museum (故宮南院)
spots.description: Positioned as an Asian Art and Culture Museum with architecture inspired by Chinese calligraphy.

spots.name: Chimei Museum (奇美博物館)
spots.description: A European-style palace housing a rich collection of Western art, musical instruments, and arms.

spots.name: Tainan Art Museum (臺南市美術館)
spots.description: Consists of Building 1 (historic) and Building 2 (modern), serving as a new art landmark in Tainan.

spots.name: National Museum of Taiwan History (國立臺灣歷史博物館)
spots.description: Located in Annan District, it comprehensively narrates the history of Taiwan.

spots.name: National Museum of Taiwan Literature (國立臺灣文學館)
spots.description: Taiwan's first national museum dedicated to literature, housed in a historic hall.

spots.name: Kaohsiung Museum of Fine Arts (高雄市立美術館)
spots.description: The most important public art museum in Southern Taiwan, located within an ecological park.

spots.name: National Science and Technology Museum (國立科學工藝博物館)
spots.description: A museum of applied science and industrial technology.

spots.name: Weiwuying National Kaohsiung Center for the Arts (衛武營國家藝術文化中心)
spots.description: The world's largest single-roof performing arts center, also featuring exhibition spaces.

spots.name: Pier-2 Art Center (駁二藝術特區)
spots.description: An open contemporary art center created from repurposed warehouses.

spots.name: National Museum of Marine Biology and Aquarium (國立海洋生物博物館)
spots.description: A world-class aquarium and museum focusing on marine ecology education.

spots.name: Pingtung Art Museum (屏東美術館)
spots.description: Taiwan's first township-level art museum, converted from the old City Hall.

spots.name: Pingyan 1936 Culture Base (屏菸1936文化基地)
spots.description: A large museum complex converted from an old tobacco factory, housing Hakka and Indigenous museums.

spots.name: Hualien County Stone Sculpture Museum (花蓮縣石雕博物館)
spots.description: The first museum in Taiwan dedicated to stone sculpture.

spots.name: National Museum of Prehistory (國立臺灣史前文化博物館)
spots.description: Showcases the rich prehistoric culture of Taiwan and Austronesian heritage.

spots.name: Taitung Art Museum (臺東美術館)
spots.description: A small art museum featuring design elements inspired by the nature of Eastern Taiwan.

spots.name: Penghu Living Museum (澎湖生活博物館)
spots.description: Introduces the daily life, history, and marine culture of the Penghu Islands.

spots.name: Kinmen Cultural Park - History and Folk Museum (金門文化園區歷史民俗博物館)
spots.description: The largest museum in Kinmen, showcasing Minnan culture and local history.
